cleaned_text: February 5, 2023 This information is for educational purposes only, to facilitate quality conversations between patients and their personal physician(s). Several additional considerations are required to safely administer any protocol for an individual. This information is NOT intended to diagnose, treat or encourage self-treatment of any medical condition. The definitions of terms such as: natural, organic, holistic, alternative, complementary, integrative, functional, homeopathic, and others are not clear and often used interchangably. They all refer to the philosphy and practice of using concepts and remedies based on nature... This page is under development. Working links will provide starting information. Please let us know about your interest in this page by emailing us [here](mailto:drcheikin@cohlife.org), and check back soon. Related Links [The State of the Evidence for Whole-System, Multi-Modality Naturopathic Medicine-A Systematic Scoping Review.2019](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/30785315/) ** [citations](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?linkname=pubmed_pubmed_citedin&from_uid=30785315) [The potential contribution of traditional, complementary and integrative treatments in acute viral respiratory tract infections-Rapid Reviews in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.2020](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33520646/) ** [Medication-free Alternatives for Long-term Maintenance of Bipolar Disorder-A Case Series.2015](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4424923/pdf/10.7453_gahmj.2014.064.pdf) ** ** a new browser tab will open
